title: Transactions failing in remix-tests with bytecode of a particular size
body:
This was originally reported in Solidity, see https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/11378#issuecomment-851037842.

We have received a bug report from @marco2357 who is experiencing weird, and non-deterministic behavior in Remix tests when the bytecode produced by the Solidity compiler has a particular size (I suspect it's the size just one byte below the Spurious Dragon bytecode size limit). The original report claims it's because the new `bytes.concat()` builtin but after a lot of debugging I'm pretty sure it's just the size of the bytecode produced by the compiler that triggers this behavior.

It also makes a transaction fail in remix-tests. I'm attaching instructions to reproduce it below. With remix-tests the repro requires raising the gas limit, which is now only possible by modifying Remix sources.

I inspected the code and output produced by Solidity and I don't see anything obviously wrong in it which is why I think it might really be an issue in Remix or one of its dependencies.

### Repro
First download the source code attached in the original issue: [problem.tar.gz](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/files/6566358/problem.tar.gz). Then:

``` bash
npm install @remix-project/remix-tests
npm install tslib

# Raise the gas limit by appending `opts.gasLimit.words[0] *= 20` in message.js
sed -i 's/\(function Message(opts) {\)/\1opts.gasLimit.words[0] *= 20;/' node_modules/ethereumjs-vm/dist/evm/message.js

tar xfv problem.tar.gz
cd problem/
npx remix-tests --compiler 0.8.4 --optimize true --runs 100 test/SellAtMarket_test.sol
```

Output:
```
  1) TestSellAtMarket: Test small

         error: Transaction has been reverted by the EVM:
{
  "transactionHash": "0xf1a1d6b6841ccc8a5455829ea453e99e65340a0b0c5f13e2f7cf45f90c3a1015",
  "transactionIndex": 0,
  "blockHash": "0x69f7b7a30c97eb7f1bbea2c8e72b43677e395381e30f78d2edcc8411852b36b9",
  "blockNumber": 4,
  "gasUsed": 5000000,
  "cumulativeGasUsed": 5000000,
  "status": false,
  "to": "0xf8e81D47203A594245E36C48e151709F0C19fBe8",
  "events": {}
}
         expected value to be undefined to: undefined
         returned: undefined
```

The error disappears if you remove or add even a single byte in any error message in the original source. Or if you change `--runs 100` to e.g. `--runs 200`, which reduces the size of the bytecode.

I managed to reproduce it by replacing one whole function with a completely different chunk of source code that just happens to take the same amount of space in the bytecode (see https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/11378#issuecomment-851037842) which is why I think it's all about the bytecode size.

Thanks for fixing this! What was the underlying issue though? I see that the fix just makes remix-tests retry on out-of-gas error but why was the error happening only with a very specific bytecode size?
